Experimenting with Billboards; Spring 2016 
Experimenting with Billboards; Spring 2016
2016 04 17 This was a fun experiment. Treasure Data, Wish and Zoom all started around the same time, and were each others customers and the CEOs were each others backers through me. After I stepped up to seed Eric Yuan of Zoom and Wish's co founders Peter Szulczewski and Danny Zhang, they backed the seed of Treasure Data. During Spring SaaS-ness 2016, we tried and were learning together about the ways of Billboard based brand marketing...
“What was I thinking when I decided to fund Zoom Founder Eric Yuan; with no product,…”
“What was I thinking when I decided to fund Zoom Founder Eric Yuan; with no product,…”
This is a note I sent out in 2012 after the initial seed at what would become Zoom. At that point we only had 20,000 users and the engagement was spotty. I almost never write long emails.. but I did this time as I could see what could play out. EVERYTHING I said would happen, has happened - even to the revenue trajectory I thought would be possible in the face of every VC telling me 'it's too hard to compete in video now with MSFT, GOOG, Cisco Webex, GoToMeeting.. Go ZOOM!

Scribd Launches a Netflix-Like Service for Digital Books - WSJ
Scribd Launches a Netflix-Like Service for Digital Books - WSJ
Scribd, long known for being a YouTube for online documents, is today launching a book-subscription service. The key details: It costs $8.99 per month, includes unlimited online access and an offline library of 20 books at a time, the only major publisher participating is HarperCollins, and the available books from HarperCollins will be those that are at least a year old.
